gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Barium Dissolved from the U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT,EPZT_Ga_V_others projects of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dissolved Barium (Ba) in US GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect, GP16. Dataset Description: <p>A section of dissolved Ba concentrations comprised of 36 stations and additional surface water sampling across the Eastern Tropical Pacific from Ecuador to Tahiti.</p><p><strong>Access restrictions:</strong><br />Access to these data will be restricted to the GEOTRACES Data Management Committee (DMC), the GEOTRACES&nbsp;Standards and Intercalibration Committee (SIC), and GEOTRACES investigators until public release of the&nbsp;next Intermediate Data Product, currently scheduled for August, 2017.</p> Acquisition Description: <p>Water column samples were taken from the GEOTRACES carousel and filtered through pre-cleaned, 0.2 um Pall Acropak Supor filter capsules as described elsewhere (e.g., Cutter et al., 2012; Hatta et al., 2015). Near surface water samples were collected using an underway towed-fish pumped seawater system (Bruland et al., 2005) with samples filtered through sequential 0.45 um Osmonics and 0.2 µm Polycarbonate (PCTE) cartridge filters. Filtered water was collected in 125 mL HDPE bottles (Nalgene) that had been precleaned by soaking in hot 1.2 M HCl (reagent grade) for at least 8 h with subsequent thorough rinsing with ultrapure distilled deionized water (Barnstead E-pure). Samples were acidified in a laminar flow bench aboard ship using 0.5 mL of ultrapure HCl per 125 mL sample.</p><p>Barium was measured using a ThermoFisher Element 2 Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer (ICP-MS) and the isotope dilution method as described by Jacquet et al. (2005). Aliquots (50 uL) of each sample were spiked with 25 uL of a 135Ba-enriched solution (~170 nM) and then diluted 30-fold with 0.2 um ultrapure filtered water. A sample of ~93% enriched 135Ba was obtained from Oak Ridge National Laboratories for use as the enriched isotope spike. The ICP-MS was operated in low resolution and both 135Ba and 138Ba were determined. The samples were bracketed every 10 samples with a blank and the spike 135Ba solution. The volumes of the spikes, samples and dilution water were accurately assessed by calibrating each pipette by weight. The reproducibility error of this method was estimated by comparing samples collected at the same depths on different casts at the same station. For 42 pairs of these replicate samples, the average absolute deviation of 1.4 nmol/kg or typically 1.5%. Repeated runs of runs of US GEOTRACES intercalibration samples and in-house reference solutions suggest a precision of ±2.0%; the limit of detection for barium was 0.7 nmol/kg. Our precision is similar to that reported by other labs for Ba (e.g., Jacquet et al., 2005).</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br />K.W. Bruland, E.L Rue, G.J. Smith, and G.R. DiTullio, 2005. Iron, macronutrients and diatom blooms in the Peru upwelling regime: brown and blue waters of Peru. Marine Chemistry 93: 81–103. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011</a></p><p>G. Cutter, K.W. Bruland, 2012. Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnol. Oceanogr.: Methods 10: 425–436. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.425" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.425</a></p><p>M. Hatta, C.I. Measures, J. Wu, S. Roshan, J.N. Fitzsimmons, P. Sedwick, P. Morton, 2015. An overview of dissolved Fe and Mn distributions during the 2010–2011 U.S. GEOTRACES North Atlantic Cruises: GEOTRACES GA03. Deep-Sea Res. II 116: 117–129.&nbsp;doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr2.2014.07.005" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr2.2014.07.005</a></p><p>S.H.M. Jacquet, F. Dehairs, D. Cardinal, J. Naveza, B. Delille, 2005. Barium distribution across the Southern Ocean frontal system in the Crozet–Kerguelen Basin. Marine Chemistry 95: 149–162. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2004.09.002" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2004.09.002</a></p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1261214 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=1261214

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Marine Science 1020 Balch Blvd.

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: U.S. GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: U.S. GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Geotraces Pacific Section: Gallium, vanadium, and associated elements indicative of dust input and redox cycling

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: Geotraces Pacific Section: Gallium, vanadium, and associated elements indicative of dust input and redox cycling

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: During the 2013 GEOTRACES Eastern Pacific Zonal Section cruise, a scientist from the University of Southern Mississippi will determine the distributions of gallium (Ga) and vanadium (V), as well as V redox speciation. The planned cruise track is ideal for this effort because it will traverse various oceanic environments that influence the biogeochemistry of these elements namely, the Peru margin/upwelling zone and the associated oxygen minimum zone, gradients in atmospheric inputs and biological productivity from the Peru margin to Tahiti, and hydrothermal vents along the East Pacific Rise. Specific goals of the project include: (1) examine the discrepancy between surface water Ga and aluminum (Al) distributions and estimate dust inputs; (2) confirm the relationship observed in the North Pacific between the surface ocean Ga/Al ratio and the chlorophyll distribution; (3) compare the surface ocean manganese distribution with that of Ga, Al, and lead to differentiate between shelf and aerosol inputs; (4) determine if there is evidence of shelf V removal which contributes to the surface ocean V depletion; (5) test for hydrothermal influences on the V distribution downstream from the East Pacific Rise; and (6) compare V redox speciation with that of other elements including selenium, arsenic, and iodine as a means of examining the importance of water column reduction versus advective interactions with reducing coastal sediments. As such, the elements selected as the focus of this study, will provide information on dust input and redox cycling, especially when compared with other elements being determined by other cruise participants.
Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cruise identification; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: Cruise name; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.
PI-supplied Description: Station number; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES event number; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Latitude, as reported by the PI.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude, as reported by the PI.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Latitude at the start of the event (north is positive), from the event log.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude at the start of the event (east is positive), from the event log.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the start of the sampling event, from the event log.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'
PI-supplied Description: Cast number; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique GEOTRACES sample number; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Saunders-Mantyla depth (integrated; uses dynamic height); as reported in the bottle file.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved Barium (Ba) concentration of samples collected by Go-Flo bottles.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for Ba_D_CONC_BOTTLE. 2 = Good data; 3 = Questionable data; 4 = Bad data.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved Barium (Ba) concentration of samples collected by GeoFish.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Quality flag for Ba_D_CONC_FISH. 2 = Good data; 3 = Questionable data; 4 = Bad data.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Sampling instrument, from the event log.; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: Sequential sample number within the cast (usually corresponds to bottle number); from the bottle file.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle
PI-supplied Description: GeoFish tow number; from the event log.; General Description: tow number/identification; applies to all towed vehicles and is generally associated with plankton net tows

PI-supplied Description: Bottle number; typically 1-24, from the bottle file.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Bottle number quality flag reported in the bottle file; follows WOCE conventions. 2 = good; 3 = questionable; 4 = bad; 9 = missing data.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the time of bottle firing, from the bottle file.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude of bottle firing (north is positive), from the bottle file.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Lonitude of bottle firing (east is positive), from the bottle file.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: The ODF software acquisition measurement of pressure, from the bottle file.; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: Fofonoff-Millard depth (non-integrated; also used by SBE), from the bottle file.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: Bottom depth, from the bottle file.; General Description: bottom depth

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD pressure, from the bottle file.; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: CTD bottle firing depth, from the bottle file.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>Water column samples were taken from the GEOTRACES carousel and filtered through pre-cleaned, 0.2 um Pall Acropak Supor filter capsules as described elsewhere (e.g., Cutter et al., 2012; Hatta et al., 2015). Near surface water samples were collected using an underway towed-fish pumped seawater system (Bruland et al., 2005) with samples filtered through sequential 0.45 um Osmonics and 0.2 µm Polycarbonate (PCTE) cartridge filters. Filtered water was collected in 125 mL HDPE bottles (Nalgene) that had been precleaned by soaking in hot 1.2 M HCl (reagent grade) for at least 8 h with subsequent thorough rinsing with ultrapure distilled deionized water (Barnstead E-pure). Samples were acidified in a laminar flow bench aboard ship using 0.5 mL of ultrapure HCl per 125 mL sample.</p><p>Barium was measured using a ThermoFisher Element 2 Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer (ICP-MS) and the isotope dilution method as described by Jacquet et al. (2005). Aliquots (50 uL) of each sample were spiked with 25 uL of a 135Ba-enriched solution (~170 nM) and then diluted 30-fold with 0.2 um ultrapure filtered water. A sample of ~93% enriched 135Ba was obtained from Oak Ridge National Laboratories for use as the enriched isotope spike. The ICP-MS was operated in low resolution and both 135Ba and 138Ba were determined. The samples were bracketed every 10 samples with a blank and the spike 135Ba solution. The volumes of the spikes, samples and dilution water were accurately assessed by calibrating each pipette by weight. The reproducibility error of this method was estimated by comparing samples collected at the same depths on different casts at the same station. For 42 pairs of these replicate samples, the average absolute deviation of 1.4 nmol/kg or typically 1.5%. Repeated runs of runs of US GEOTRACES intercalibration samples and in-house reference solutions suggest a precision of ±2.0%; the limit of detection for barium was 0.7 nmol/kg. Our precision is similar to that reported by other labs for Ba (e.g., Jacquet et al., 2005).</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br />K.W. Bruland, E.L Rue, G.J. Smith, and G.R. DiTullio, 2005. Iron, macronutrients and diatom blooms in the Peru upwelling regime: brown and blue waters of Peru. Marine Chemistry 93: 81–103. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2004.06.011</a></p><p>G. Cutter, K.W. Bruland, 2012. Rapid and noncontaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnol. Oceanogr.: Methods 10: 425–436. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.425" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.425</a></p><p>M. Hatta, C.I. Measures, J. Wu, S. Roshan, J.N. Fitzsimmons, P. Sedwick, P. Morton, 2015. An overview of dissolved Fe and Mn distributions during the 2010–2011 U.S. GEOTRACES North Atlantic Cruises: GEOTRACES GA03. Deep-Sea Res. II 116: 117–129.&nbsp;doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr2.2014.07.005" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr2.2014.07.005</a></p><p>S.H.M. Jacquet, F. Dehairs, D. Cardinal, J. Naveza, B. Delille, 2005. Barium distribution across the Southern Ocean frontal system in the Crozet–Kerguelen Basin. Marine Chemistry 95: 149–162. doi:<a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2004.09.002" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2004.09.002</a></p>

<p><strong>Data quality flags: </strong><br />2 = Good data;<br />3 = Questionable data;<br />4 = Bad data.</p><p><strong>Intercalibration:</strong><br />Table 1 lists intercalibration data for reference waters, both our results and results we were able to find from collaborators. Results are reasonably comparable within the 2% precision generally given for Ba analysis. Note that European labs analyzing Ba tend to report values for one of the SLRS reference waters as well as an in house standard. We are hopeful that other data from the BATS crossover station will soon be available to make a better comparison.</p><p><img alt="Table of Barium intercalibration data for reference waters" src="http://dmoserv3.whoi.edu/data_docs/GEOTRACES/EPZT/shiller/Barium_table1.PNG" /></p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing:</strong><br />- modified parameter names to conform to BCO-DMO and GEOTRACES IDP parameter naming conventions;<br />- separated Barium columns in _BOTTLE and _FISH, in accordance with the GEOTRACES IDP conventions;<br />- replaced blanks (missing data) with "nd" ("no data").</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing by BCO-DMO: </strong><br />As was done for the GEOTRACES-NAT data, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: cruise_id, EXPOCODE,SECT_ID, STNNBR, CASTNO, GEOTRC_EVENTNO, GEOTRC_SAMPNO, GEOTRC_INSTR, SAMPNO, GF_NO, BTLNBR, BTLNBR_FLAG_W, DATE_START_EVENT, TIME_START_EVENT, ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT, EVENT_LAT, EVENT_LON, DEPTH_MIN, DEPTH_MAX, BTL_DATE, BTL_TIME, BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC, BTL_LAT, BTL_LON, ODF_CTDPRS, SMDEPTH, FMDEPTH, BTMDEPTH, CTDPRS, CTDDEPTH.</p><p>This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter-comparison of the datasets.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle and ODF_Bottle datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the TN303 Event Log (version 30 Oct 2014). Where applicable, pump information was taken from the PUMP_Nuts_Sals dataset.</p><p>A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.</p><p>If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.</p><p>See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Teflon TM Instrument Description: GO-FLO Teflon-lined Trace Metal free sampling bottles are used for collecting water samples for trace metal, nutrient and pigment analysis. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is designed specifically to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: CTD Sea-Bird SBE 911plus Instrument Short Name:CTD SBE 911plus Instrument Description: The Sea-Bird SBE 911plus is a type of CTD instrument package for continuous measurement of conductivity, temperature and pressure. The SBE 911plus includes the SBE 9plus Underwater Unit and the SBE 11plus Deck Unit (for real-time readout using conductive wire) for deployment from a vessel. The combination of the SBE 9plus and SBE 11plus is called a SBE 911plus. The SBE 9plus uses Sea-Bird's standard modular temperature and conductivity sensors (SBE 3plus and SBE 4). The SBE 9plus CTD can be configured with up to eight auxiliary sensors to measure other parameters including dissolved oxygen, pH, turbidity, fluorescence, light (PAR), light transmission, etc.). more information from Sea-Bird Electronics Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0058/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
